Adaptation.Condition: Only once per game. Each player.
Adaptation.Reward: Flip one die to its opposing face.

Anticipation.Condition: Each round. The starting player. Before using a die.

Control.Condition: Same value on both Axis dice.

Mastery.Condition: Same value on both Engines dice.

Synchronisation.Condition: One die on Landing Gear, one die on Flaps.
Synchronisation.Reward: Roll and use the black traffic die as any color.

Team Work.Condition: Each round, players may put a die here.
Team Work.Reward: Swap dice values and put them back into the hand.

Pilot - Title2.text: Pick 1 or 2 depending on the scenario

fields.text: If you select multiple scenarios, one of them will be chosen at random.

thenRoutine: var scenarios = ${PROPERTY scenarios OF Scenario Generation Button}

fields.text: This will restart the game. Are you sure?

info.description: Roll and place dice to control an aircraft and eventually land it safely on an airport.

info.ruleText:
Goal

The altitude track on the right reduces once per round. When at 0, the plane must have reached the airport (second track), all other planes must be gone and several systems of the plane must have been configured for landing.

Setup

Two players take a seat as pilot and co-pilot on the left side of the board, revealing their private dice.

Round Overview

  1. The first phase is a strategy discussion among both players. You're not allowed to plan for exact dice values (for example "if I roll a 6, I'll put it there immediately").
  2. Then, both players roll their four dice by clicking on the button below them. From now on, no talking is allowed until all dice are placed.
  3. Now the starting player (indicated by the colored forward on the lowest section of the altitude track) places their first die on any empty spot with matching color and number (images have no number restriction).
  4. Players now alternate placing one die at a time following the same rules.
  5. After placing all eight dice, the altitude track is dragged one section towards the bottom.
In every round, it is required to have two dice in the  Axis system and two dice in the  Engine system.

Reroll Tokens

  • The altitude track on the far right contains two  Reroll Tokens (at 6000 and 2000).
  • As soon as you reach the indicated height, drag the reroll token to your stash (for example top left).
  • You reach 6000 at the start of the game, so you immediately get one reroll token.
  • At any point during a round, any player may decide to spend a reroll token from the stash. At that point, both players are allowed to reroll any of their remaining dice.
  • For red and black scenarios, remove the reroll token from the 2000 section and keep it as a spare in case you need it for one of the  Abilities.

Dice Systems

Depending on where the dice are placed, the systems on the plane activate and cause certain changes.

 Radio
  • If you place a 2 on a radio spot, you remove one plane from the second section (and only the second section) of the approach track from the bottom. Other die values work accordingly.
 Axis
  • As soon as two dice are placed on the axis spots, calculate the difference of the dice and tilt the axis marker that many ticks to the larger side by clicking on the appropriate arrow. When it reaches a , you lose.
  • The aircraft tilt is not reset between rounds and needs to be centered for landing.
 Landing Gear
  • The pilot is responsible for deploying all three landing gears before landing.
  • Flip the switch below the die.
  • The order does not matter.
  • Each time one is deployed, the blue [subproperty] gets moved one spot to the right, affecting the  Engines.
 Flaps
  • The co-pilot is responsible for deploying all four flaps before landing.
  • Flip the switch below the die.
  • They need to be deployed from top to bottom.
  • Each time one is deployed, the orange [subproperty] gets moved one spot to the right, affecting the  Engines.
 Engines
  • As soon as two dice are placed on the engine spots, calculate the sum of the dice and check it against the engine indicators:
    • If it is below the blue [subproperty], the plane does not move.
    • If it is between the blue and orange [subproperty], the plane moves one spot. Drag the approach track one piece to the bottom.
    • If it is above the orange [subproperty], the plane moves two spots
  • If another plane is dragged below the screen, you crash with it and lose the game.
  • If the airport is dragged below the screen, you passed it and lose the game.
 Brakes
  • The pilot is responsible for activating at least one brake before landing.
  • Flip the switch below the die.
  • They need to be deployed from left to right.
  • Each time one is deployed, the red [subproperty] gets moved one spot to the right, affecting the  Engines in the last round.
 Coffee
  • When placed on one of the coffee spots, activate one of the coffee markers.
  • Whenever any player places a die, they can deactivate one or several coffee markers to increase or decrease the value of the die by one each.
  • You can't turn a 1 into a 6 or the other way around.
  • Click a die to alter its value or reroll it.

Last Round

When the altitude marker reaches 0, you play one final round. Several conditions have to be met in order to win the game:
  1. At the start of the last round, the airport must be the only thing still visible on the approach track.
  2. The sum of the  Engine dice is compared to the  Brakes this round. It has to be less than the red [subproperty].
  3. At the end of the round, the  Axis may not be tilted.
  4. At the end of the round, all  Landing Gears and  Flaps need to be deployed.
If you want to play the same scenario again, you can press the restart_alt button in the top right corner to reset the board.

Scenarios

After a successful landing in YUL, you can use the  button in the top right corner to select several scenarios in four different difficulty levels. They include new challenges:

 Traffic Die
  • At the beginning of each round, look at the bottom most piece of the approach track.
  • For each black die, roll the black traffic die once and place one spare plane token onto the approach track at the section indicated by the rolled value. So if you rolled a 2, place a token on the second section from the bottom.
  • If you skip a section with dice by going forward two sections, don't roll the die for the skipped section.
 Turns
  • Some sections of the approach track might have a white area that shows restrictions for the tilt of the  Axis.
  • Whenever you drag a section of the approach track off screen, the  Axis has to be tilted to an allowed angle. Otherwise, you lose the game.
  • The tilt restriction also applies if the section is skipped because the plane moves two sections at once.
 Kerosene
  • Each round your plane uses kerosene.
  • Place a die above the kerosene indicator and move the yellow [subproperty] marker down according to the die value.
  • If there is no die there at the end of each round, move the yellow [subproperty] marker down 6 places.
  • If the yellow [subproperty] marker ever reaches "X", you lose the game.
 Intern
  • You have to train your intern before landing by using every green die.
  • Place one of your dice onto the intern module and use the green die closest to your die as if it was your die.
  • You may not use a die of the same value as the one you'll be getting.
 Abilities
  • Depending on the scenario, you may pick one or two ability cards that will provide benefits.
  • Each card has a condition on the top that tells you, when it applies, and a reward on the bottom.
 Wind
  • Whenever the second  Axis die is placed, the tilt indicator gets updated as usual and afterwards the wind indicator gets turned as many ticks as the axis is currently tilted. So if the the axis is tilted two arrows to the left, the wind indicator will be turned two ticks to the left from its previous position.
  • So even if the axis tilt stays at the same -2 for four rounds, the wind marker will be turned two ticks to the left in each of the four rounds.
  • Whenever the second  Engine die is placed, the number pointed to by the wind indicator will be added to the sum of the engine dice.
  • The wind also counts in the last round when comparing the  Engines to the  Brakes.
 Ice Brakes
  • The  Ice Brakes replace the normal  Brakes of the plane so it can land on icy runways.
  • The red [subproperty] marker can only be advanced if two dice with the same value are placed above and below the brake indicator in the same round.
  • All the ice brakes must be activated in the last round.
  • It's allowed to do multiple steps in one round.
 Kerosene Leak
  • Rules of  Kerosene apply.
  • Except the amount of kerosene you lose per round is calculated by the difference of the two  Engine dice plus one.
Timer
  • Immediately after rolling the dice, start a 60 second timer.
  • Don't place any dice when the timer elapsed.
  • As usual, you lose the game, if one of the  Engine dice or  Axis dice is missing.
